column3: str
A supply wagon to Revenant's Toll is late, and Guolgeim will know the reason why.

The wagon's usual route brings it within shouting─and mug-raising─distance of the Fallgourd Float, if Guolgeim's tart comment is any indication. See if the Wood Wailers at the Float know more of this matter.

You find the Wailers somewhat distracted, having just received word of an Ixali attack on a wagon. The duty officer doubts that it is the selfsame wagon you seek, but you know there are no coincidences in the North Shroud. Another of the Float's Wailers is on the scene, a road to the east, if you wish to inquire further.

You arrive only to be informed that it was indeed a supply wagon that was attacked, and both the cargo and the drivers were captured. You are vindicated, but a difficult rescue-and-recovery mission is indicated. To the logging grounds you must go, to free the two captives and recover 3 crates of looted supplies.

You successfully liberated two people and several crates of cargo. Only the drivers can tell you whether Revenant's Toll will get its supplies. Return to the road east of the Fallgourd Float and speak to the Elezen.

You discover that the wagon is too damaged for the supply run to continue on to Revenant's Toll. Guolgeim will not be please to hear it, but still, things could have been much worse. Return with due optimism to the Toll and make your report to Guolgeim.

Your optimism turns out to have been justified, for Guolgeim was expecting far worse news. As a denizen of the Toll, she is privy to all manner of rumors, including persistent whispers of the Primals' return…

Well, now. A real nick you are, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>, always showing up just when you're needed.
I'm waiting on a supply wagon from Gridania. It should ha' been here by now, even if they stopped a spell in the Fallgourd Float to chew the fat and wet their whistles.

The wagon always goes through the North Shroud. Here, stretch those <Switch(PlayerParameter(71))><Case(1)>strong</Case><Case(2)>long</Case><Case(3)>chubby</Case><Case(4)>pretty</Case><Case(5)>thewy</Case></Switch> legs some, why don't you? Go ask the Wood Wailers over in the Float if they've seen somethin'.
The supply route goes through the North Shroud. The Wood Wailers over at the Fallgourd Float might know something.
The wagon to Revenant's Toll? Hasn't been here, I can tell you that.
But..surely it can't be the same wagon…? Well, we just had word of an Ixali attack on a wagon, you see.
Seems like too much of a coincidence, but you never know.
May as well have a look, eh? You'll find one of our men on the scene─the attack was on the road to the east of here.
The wagon attack was on the road to the east of here. There's one of us from the Fallgourd Float there, if you want to poke around.
Hell–<Emphasis>o</Emphasis>, what have we here? An adventurer, by the Twelve, and a suitably gaunt one!
As you can see, a couple of gentlemen of the road─err, gentlelizards if you must─ambushed a supply run. Took the wagon, the cargo, and both drivers─how's <Emphasis>that</Emphasis> for a day's work?
The wagon treads lead to the Ixali logging grounds to the northwest. You look a hungry sort, how about it? Will you rescue the drivers and recover those supplies?
Looks like the Ixal took the wagon to their logging grounds, due northwest. Someone needs to rescue the two captives and recover those supplies, if you take my meaning.
I knew you could save them! Well done, adventurer!
Thank you for freeing me, stranger. I can manage alone from here on.
I shall make my way back to where the wagon was attacked. The Twelve speed your way, adventurer.
Whew, I thought I was done for! These supply runs are getting a little too interesting for my tastes.
I'd best get out of here before the lizzies show up again. Many thanks, and try not to get killed!
We are both in your debt, good adventurer. I shudder to think what fate the Ixal had in mind for us.
You seek supplies meant for Revenant's Toll? It pains me to say, this is all that remains.
The wagon is in no state to resume the journey, nor are the chocobos. We shall have to arrange another transport─will you inform the Toll?

Well now, it's getting late. I'd say it's time we <Emphasis>all</Emphasis> hot-footed it out of here, before someone else gets captured. Then where would we be? Our heads cut off and lining the road, likely.
The wagon is in no state to resume the journey, nor are the chocobos. We shall have to arrange another transport─will you inform the Toll?
Attacked? By the Ixal! Well roll me in stardust an' dash it from the sky!
Not that I oughta be s'prised, mind you. Gossip's fleet where adventurers sleep, and there's talk of the Primals waking. And it's always the beastmen who won't let a sleeping Primal lie, innit?
But never mind that, you did well enough. Even got some of the supplies. I'd go put some meat on your bones with that reward─looking a might thin, you are.
